diagnosis.score_summary: Jergens is suffering from a generational split. The WWW remains a dignified, heritage-driven 'Trusted Friend,' while the PDP has mutated into a loud, 'Gen-Z Pop' hype machine to survive the algorithm.

truth_1.headline: Pleasure vs. Prescription
truth_1.gap_description: WWW sells a 'Sensory Experience' (no odor, streak-free). PDP sells 'Derm-Validation' (#1 Recommended). One apologizes for the product's chemistry; the other weaponizes its authority.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'No self-tanner odor' (Sensory) vs. PDP: '#1 US Dermatologist Recommended' (Authority)
truth_1.why_matters: The customer doesn't know if they are buying a spa treatment (WWW) or a medical intervention (PDP). This creates a 'Clinical vs. Cosmetic' dissonance that weakens the premium perception.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are torn between mitigating the negatives (smell) and amplifying the credentials (doctors). The data shows the 'White Coat' sells better than the 'Good Smell.' You must choose: either scrub the sensory defensive language from the site and wear the medical badge globally (Option A), or drop the clinical shield on Amazon and sell the sensory dream of the glow (Option B). You cannot be both a prescription and a perfume.

truth_2.headline: The Identity Crisis
truth_2.gap_description: WWW is 'Earthy Organic' (Warm, Safe, Clinical Pop). PDP is 'Gen-Z Pop' (Inflatable pools, Hot Pink, Dopamine). Your website looks like a dermatology clinic, but your Amazon page looks like a pool party.
truth_2.why_matters: Inconsistency in visual physics breaks the brand aura. A user clicking from the calm, trusted website to the chaotic, neon Amazon page feels like they walked into the wrong store.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: You are trying to be a heritage brand on the dot-com and a TikTok brand on the marketplace. The compromise creates a schizophrenic face. You must decide: either update the global identity to 'Dopamine Pop' and risk alienating the core boomer customer (Option A), or discipline the Amazon page back to 'Clinical Warmth' and risk boring the youth (Option B). A brand cannot be both a library and a rave.

truth_3.headline: Nature vs. The Lab
truth_3.gap_description: WWW relies on 'The Green Lab' narrative (Vitamin E, Nature refined). PDP relies on 'The Lab Breakthrough' (PhDs, Chemicals). WWW tells a story of ingredients; PDP tells a story of institutions.
truth_3.evidence: [NARRATIVE] WWW: 'The Green Lab' (Nature) vs. PDP: 'The Lab Breakthrough' (Sterile)
truth_3.why_matters: The origin story is fractured. If the product is 'Natural,' the sterile lab imagery on Amazon hurts it. If it is 'Clinical,' the botanical focus on WWW dilutes the power.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: You are straddling the line between a botanical remedy and a chemical solution. The market rewards specificity. You must choose: either lean into the 'Vitamin E' story and remove the sterile lab imagery (Option A), or own the 'Chemical Engineering' narrative and drop the botanical pretense (Option B). Nature and Science are good partners, but bad roommates.

truth_4.headline: Sexy vs. Sweet
truth_4.gap_description: WWW leans into the 'Lover' archetype (Sensual, Glow, Heat). PDP leans into the 'Innocent' archetype (Sunshine, Happy, Cute). It is a subtle drift from seduction to optimism.
truth_4.evidence: Secondary Archetype: WWW (The Lover) vs. PDP (The Innocent)
truth_4.why_matters: This confuses the emotional end-benefit. Is the 'Glow' for attraction (Lover) or for internal happiness (Innocent)? Different motivations require different triggers.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: You are whispering seduction on your site but singing nursery rhymes on Amazon. This dilutes the emotional hook. You must choose: either sexualize the Amazon listing to match the 'Sensual' promise of the site (Option A), or sanitize the website to 'Sunshine' and own the innocent joy of the glow (Option B).

truth_5.headline: The Herd Is Right
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels align on 'The Safe Choice' (Territory 1). However, PDP weaponizes this with '#1 Rank' and '10,000 Ratings,' while WWW is modest. The Marketplace proves that 'Safety in Numbers' is the killer app.
truth_5.evidence: Social Benefits: PDP execution (Hard Numbers) > WWW execution (Soft Trust)
truth_5.why_matters: Your own website is too humble. The Amazon listing proves that the sheer volume of adoption is the strongest selling point you have.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: The Amazon page screams 'Winner,' while the website whispers 'Trusted.' The market clearly responds to the volume. You must choose: either turn your website into a shrine to popularity with massive badges and counters (Option A), or maintain the boutique elegance and accept lower conversion (Option B). In this category, the crowd is the authority.

marker_1.so_what: Both channels agree: the goal is 'Happiness' and 'Sunshine', not just skin repair.

marker_2.so_what: Perfect alignment on mass accessibility and democratic beauty.

marker_3.so_what: Both channels prioritize safety ('No odor', 'gradual') over speed.

marker_4.so_what: Consistent positioning as a reliable, heritage staple, despite PDP's slightly more polished look.

marker_5.so_what: The brand maintains a warm, supportive 'BFF' persona across both channels.

marker_6.so_what: Strong core alignment on 'Caregiver', but a subtle drift from 'Lover' (WWW) to 'Innocent' (PDP).

marker_7.so_what: Major disconnect: WWW is a helpful guide; PDP is a cheeky, loud hype-man.

marker_8.so_what: Visual chaos: WWW is safe/warm; PDP is neon/inflatable/loud.

marker_9.so_what: Both promise the dream, but PDP pushes the aspiration harder (5/5).

marker_10.so_what: WWW tells a story of nature (Vitamin E); PDP tells a story of sterile science.

marker_11.so_what: Complete conflict: WWW sells 'feel/smell'; PDP sells 'doctor approval'.

marker_12.so_what: Both position the product as a smart, efficient 'hack' for daily glow.

marker_13.so_what: WWW tries to inspire; PDP just tries to close the deal with charts and urgency.

marker_14.so_what: Locked alignment: the product corrects skin tone while moisturizing.

marker_15.so_what: Both sell confidence, but WWW focuses on 'Delight' while PDP focuses on 'Reassurance'.

marker_16.so_what: Consistent appeal to the rational buyer who wants a smart deal.

marker_17.so_what: Both leverage the power of the crowd (Safe Choice), though PDP shouts it louder.
